Description: Sherd of pottery large closed vessel body and handle attachment; yellow-beige slip; painted purple decoration; coarse; thick walled. Organic red-brown Nile silt with a grey core, abundant mica, white and quartz inclusions. Two bands at neck-shoulder join; frieze of short verticals between pairs of bands below handle level; wave pattern below and then further band of verticals between bands and bead-and-reel band at lower break.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.057)
